result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Denton Ricardo Ewers was found guilty of OWI (9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit to and comply with an alcohol assessment by the approved public treatment facility and comply with the development of a driver safety plan.

records.addlTxt: Court advises defendant of elements of count 1 OWI 9th offense/max. penalties, felony prohibitions and constitutional rights.  Defendant pleads guilty.  PLQ/WRF filed.  Plea Colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights & plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of count 1 dismiss counts 2-4.  No PSI requested by either side.  Court sentences defendant to 6 yrs State Prison system; 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, eligible for ERP, not eligible for CIP, 509 days credit; waive costs, fees & surcharges; revoke D/L 3 yrs; AA/DSP; IID Order 3 yrs; conditions of ES leave to probation to set.  Dismiss 14TR483.  Advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will plead to Count 1 OWI 9th  of Amended Info, in exchange, State will recom. 3 yrs IC, 3 yrs ES, no objection to find him eligible for ERP, 509 days credit.

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers appeared by phone means.  Attorney Roger M. Hillestad in court.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing set at court's request.  State filed in Dec. 2014 adding PAC charge, no plea entered on that charge.  Hearing scheduled to get a plea on all charges.  Court reminds defendant of charges in count 1, 2, 3 and advised defendant of charge in count 4/max penalties and constitutional rights.  Also a traffic citation tracking along of open intoxicant.  NGP entered all counts, all cases.
Letter to be considered as Motion pursuant to Wis. Stats. 906.09.  The State seeks to impeach the defendant...

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hrg. on defendant's Motion to Suppress.  Sworn & testified Officer Mitchell Checkalska.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court denies motion to suppress.  Atty Hillestad requests JT. Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Roger M. Hillestad.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Hillestad now appointed by PD office.  Motion to Suppress to be rescheduled.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Atty Roger Hillestad appt'd.
Status conference at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter was set for Motion Hearing.  Mr. Waters requests court allow him to withdraw as counsel.  Defendant agrees to Mr. Waters w/drawing as counsel.  Court will permit Mr. Waters to withdraw when a new attorney is appointed.  Court sets matter for 9/28 @ 3 p.m. as STC not the motion to suppress hrg. to give new attorney time.  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Order to Transport.  The warden/superintendent with physical custody of the person subject to this order at the time of its execution shall make that person available to the sheriff of Pepin County.  The sheriff shall convey that person to 740 7th Avenue West for proceedings in the Circuit Court of Pepin County on September 21, 2015 at 2:30 p.m.
M.C. is required to appear on 09/21/2015 at 2:30 pm

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Patrick William Waters.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Patrick W. Waters.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters of potential collateral attack & requests a new date that will either be a motion hearing or a plea/sentencing.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Patrick W. Waters.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Adam Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint filed but missing PAC.  Continue arraignment to 12/2.  Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court with attorney Patrick W. Waters.  Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Waters requests P.H. within time limits.  Referred to scheduling clerk.

Defendant Denton Ricardo Ewers in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin by phone.    Judge advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights including the right to a prelim. hrg. w/in 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $5000 cash bond.  Court sets bond at $5000 cash with return date of next Tuesday.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
